required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Potential Effects of Electronic Nicotine Delivery System Flavor Regulations on African American Menthol Smokers
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Electronic Nicotine Delivery System Flavor Regulations on Tobacco Behavior, Toxicity, and Abuse Liability Among African American Menthol Smokers

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to better understand how the availability of electronic nicotine delivery system (aka electronic cigarettes) flavors (e.g., menthol, tobacco) impacts tobacco use behaviors, toxicant exposure, and abuse liability among African American menthol smokers.

detailed_description.textblock: Black/African American (AA) menthol smokers are disproportionately harmed by tobacco products and could experience significant health benefits from increased availability of well-regulated electronic nicotine delivery systems (ENDS). The current study will evaluate whether ENDS flavor availability affects measures of tobacco use, biomarkers of cigarette/ENDS exposure, and addiction among AA menthol smokers by performing a 3-arm, 6-week clinical trial of ENDS provision with follow-up to 30 days. Results of this work will help FDA make predictions about the impact of moving from the current regulatory market were menthol/tobacco flavored ENDS cartridges are available, to one where only tobacco or unflavored cartridges are available, in order to maximize health-promoting effects and minimize unintended consequences among AA menthol smokers.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Average Daily Cigarette Use
primary_outcome.description: Number of cigarettes used in the past day, collected via daily text survey, averaged over the past week
A biomarker of combusted cigarette use collected from exhaled breath

primary_outcome.measure: Willingness to Substitute from Cigarettes to ENDS
primary_outcome.description: Measure of substitution for condition-specific tobacco products will be assessed using drug purchase tasks. Choices made during this task are not reinforced.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Average Daily ENDS Use
secondary_outcome.description: Number of ENDS puffs in the past day, collected via daily text survey, averaged over the past week
A biomarker of combusted cigarette use collected from urine
A biomarker of ENDS use collected from urine
Willingness to pay for condition-specific tobacco products will be assessed using drug purchase tasks. Choices made during this task are not reinforced.

arm_group.description: Menthol+Tobacco - where both menthol and tobacco flavored liquids for electronic nicotine delivery systems are available to choose from
Tobacco - where only tobacco flavored liquid is available for electronic nicotine delivery systems
Unflavored - where only unflavored liquid is available for electronic nicotine delivery systems

intervention.description: Participants are first instructed to smoke their usual brand of menthol cigarettes normally for the next 7 days and avoid using any other tobacco products. After this baseline week, participants are randomized to 1 of 3 ENDS flavor conditions, all contain 5% nicotine (Mentol+Tobacco, Tobacco, Unflavored) with equal probability and provided with a supply of their condition specific ENDS and asked to use it in place of their usual menthol cigarettes for the next 6 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- between 21-55 years of age
- identify as Black/African American (single or multi-race)
- have used ≥5 cigarettes per day for ≥1 year
- biochemically confirmed cigarette smoking status
- regular cigarette brand is flavored to taste like menthol or mint
- ENDS use in the past 30 days
- report no intent to quit smoking in the next 6 months
- previous quit attempt using evidence-based method
- have a working mobile phone with a texting/data plan
- are willing receive phone calls/text messages and complete internet-based/online surveys related to the study.
- read and write in English
Exclusion Criteria:
- are unwilling to use ENDS as part of the trial
- report other tobacco use >10 days in past 30 other than cigarettes
- unstable or significant medical condition in the past 12 months
- report >15 days of marijuana use in the past 30 days
- report any other illegal drug use in past 30 days
- report intent to become pregnant or current pregnancy/breastfeeding
- report any other condition that may affect participant safety or not allow them to fully participate in the study
